p: Several studies have compared C. longa with other species of different genera regarding its anti-inflammatory effect. For example, a study compared the anti-inflammatory activity of rhizomes of C. longa (turmeric), and Zingiber officinale (ginger) in rat adjuvant-induced arthritis (AIA) [ 39] and showed the anti-inflammatory activity of turmeric over ginger and indomethacin against the rheumatoid arthritis onset/progression displayed in AIA. Another study found that UP1304, a combination containing the standardized extract of C. longa rhizome and Morus alba root, was used to treat symptoms of arthritis [ 40].
